meanings.definition: In a sneaky manner; slyly or deceptively.
meanings.sent1: He peeked sneakily around the corner to see if anyone was watching.
meanings.sent2: The cat moved sneakily through the grass, trying to catch the bird.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon sneakily stole the cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The shadows crept sneakily across the room as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: She smiled sneakily as she played a prank on her friend.

meanings.definition: Done in a secretive or furtive way.
meanings.sent1: The sneakily planned surprise party was a great success.
meanings.sent2: The thief made a sneakily quick escape before anyone noticed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a sneakily clever move to outsmart the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger had a sneakily charming smile.
meanings.sent5: The detective admired the suspect's sneakily hidden clues.
